page.title: 17Farming
page.content:
Wetley Rocks is a village in Staffordshire where there are a large number of small dairy farms.The farms grow grass for the cattle to feed on. All the farms need to have are sheds or barns to put the cows into in winter, and also for milking them in. The milk itself is very important because it helps to produce cheese,cream, yoghurt and butter.
Old Hall Farm,Consall. This is the original Consall Hall and is 300 years old.It has 72 acres and is a dairy farm.Working hours are from 6.30am to 7.30pm.The two people who run the farm have lived there for 24 yrs. They have Fresian and Hereford cows. The cows are stalled from October to May in a computerized barn. They wear microchips and their share of food is dispensed to them automatically.
